reasoning: Reporting prevalence rather than incidence - colorectal adenomas are detected lesions found in ~25% of adults during screening colonoscopy (varies 15-40% by age/region). Prevalence more appropriate than incidence for screening-detected precancerous lesions.
source: Lieberman DA et al. (2000). Use of colonoscopy to screen asymptomatic adults for colorectal cancer. N Engl J Med. 343:162-168
